page.title: 06YANWORTH - SHOPPING PROBLEMS
page.content: {The baker }calls on Mondays and Thursdays and {two milkmen}share the trade on alternate days.{No travelling {shops}reach Yanworth. The village {shop / post office closed around 1954/1955. In different premises the post office continued to sell a limited range of bacon, sugar, sweets etc. until it closed around 1968/1969. From a private house it was possible to buy some cigarettes and chocolate until 1981/1982. {The census revealed that 80% of {the households had a car _ only 9% of {pensioners lived in households without {a car. } Perhaps this is just as well for while most rural communities depend on private transport for travel to work and entertainment, {Yanworth {people more than most rely on their {cars for obtaining their basic food {requirements.
